conclusion: To solve the problem, examine the image for relevant information about the vehicle's motion and analyze the position-time graph to determine the vehicle's acceleration.
The image depicts a position-time graph with time on the x-axis and position on the y-axis. A straight line starts at the origin and moves upwards at a constant slope.
The slope of the line represents the vehicle's velocity, and since the slope is constant, it indicates constant acceleration.
To find the acceleration, use the equation of motion: a = slope/1.
Given the slope is 10 m/s per second, the acceleration is 10 m/sÂ².
